spas
Interface IBundle

All Known Implementing Classes:
Bundle
public interface IBundle

A bundle of sensory stimulations. So far, a bundle is defined by its visual and its tactile stimulation. Other stimulations are optional. A bundle may correspond to a physical object according to Hume's bundle theory (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bundle_theory)

Author:
Olivier

getExtrapersonalAttractiveness

int getExtrapersonalAttractiveness(int clock)
ATTRACTIVENESS_OF_FISH (400) if this bundle's gustatory stimulation is STIMULATION_TASTE_FISH. ATTRACTIVENESS_OF_FISH + 10 (410) if the fish is touched. Otherwise ATTRACTIVENESS_OF_UNKNOWN (200) if this bundle has been forgotten, or 0 if this bundle has just been visited.

Parameters:
clock - Ernest's current clock value.
Returns:
This bundle's attractiveness at the given time.

getPeripersonalAttractiveness

int getPeripersonalAttractiveness(int clock)

setLastTimeBundled

void setLastTimeBundled(int clock)
Updating the bundle's time value will impact its attractiveness (bundles remain unattractive for a while after being checked)

Parameters:
clock - The current value of Ernest's clock when the bundle is checked.

trace

void trace(ITracer tracer,
           java.lang.String label)
Trace this bundle.

Parameters:
tracer - The tracer.
label - The label of the element that contains the bundle's data in the trace.
